pageTitle: Vietnam Tour of Duty Photographs from Ken Hicks
pageIntro:
A collection of photographs by Ken Hicks (Delta Company, 1st Battalion, 3rd Marines) taken during his tour of duty in the Vietnam War.

Photographs © 1967-2019 Ken Hicks; published with permission as compliments to The Cage, an in-progress book project.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh
photos.content: Loading CH-46 at the Ponderosa for a 5 day patrol.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh
photos.content: CH-46 landing at Ponderosa to lift out a 5 day patrol.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh
photos.content: BCH-34 loading at the Ponderosa, Khe Sanh. The Ponderosa was a combat outpost outside the wire. Delta Company occupied it when the Battalion first arrived there.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh
photos.content: Bill Hibbard washing clothes near the Ponderosa.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh

photos.subtitle: Phu Bai Airfield - MAG 36
photos.content: Digging in just outside of MAG (Marine Air Group) 36, Phu Bai airfield south of Hue City off Highway 1. We had humped from the coast to Phu Bai.
Bill Hibbard and Carol Giles; probably on the Deluth. Probably end of May, early June.

photos.subtitle: U.S.S. Okinawa
photos.content: Bill Hibbard. Probably on the Okinawa, but maybe the Deluth.

photos.subtitle: U.S.S. Okinawa
photos.content: CH-34 on the flight deck of the U.S.S. Okinawa.

photos.subtitle: U.S.S. Okinawa
photos.content: CH-34 on the flight deck of the U.S.S. Okinawa.
U.S.S. Okinawa from the U.S.S. Bayfield.
Punji pit. Probably between Phu Bai and Hue City along the coast. The French called that area 'The Streets Without Joy'.
Camp Evans, 4th Marines rear off of Highway 1, north of Hue City and South of Quang Tri. This is well after Operation Beaver Cage; probably in June.
Amtracs south of the DMZ - May '67.
M-60 MG. Not sure where this is. The position is built up with lumber, with overhead, so it’s not a hasty fighting hole.
Climbing cargo nets down the side of the Bayfield.
Climbing cargo nets down the side of the Bayfield.
Camp Evans. Home of 4th Marines. North of Hue City off of Highway 1.
Carrol Giles in front of patrol getting ready to move out on CH-46.
Bill Peters, Bill Hibbard, Carrol Giles, and unidentified.
